TITLE: Paul Whelan released from solitary confinement in Russian prison
SUMMARY: Paul Whelan, a US citizen detained in Russia, has been released from solitary confinement in his Mordovian penal colony in the country, according to Russian state news agency TASS.

TITLE: Covid-19 hospitalizations are reaching all-time highs in parts of the South, with some patients unable to get the care they would normally receive
SUMMARY: The US is averaging more than 100,000 new daily Covid-19 cases each day, the highest in nearly six months, according to data from Johns Hopkins University.

TITLE: What experts are learning about the Lambda variant
SUMMARY: As the coronavirus pandemic continues, infections caused by the Lambda variant have been emerging in the United States, including in Texas, where Houston Methodist Hospital last month reported its first case.

TITLE: Physicians want the media to change their coverage of Covid
SUMMARY: Media coverage of Covid-19 is constantly shifting and adapting as the Delta variant continues to spread around the globe — and physicians are getting frustrated.

TITLE: Republican disagrees with Ron DeSantis' handling of Covid-19
SUMMARY: Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-LA) says that he disagrees with Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis' taking a top down approach in handling the Covid-19 pandemic, saying that decisions on mask mandates and restrictions should be made at the local level.

TITLE: Analysis: DeSantis' reckless experiment could yield alarming results for his state
SUMMARY: The back-to-school season is turning into a frightening one for parents and children as they find themselves in the middle of political skirmishes over mask and vaccine mandates, leaving students' safety determined more by geography and the political whims of governors than the science that should be guiding best practices.

TITLE: Education secretary pleads with politicians making it harder to control Covid-19 pandemic
SUMMARY: Education Secretary Miguel Cardona issued a plea on Sunday to politicians making it harder to control the pandemic while two Republicans called for local officials to make decisions regarding masks in schools amid the fallout over state bans on masks as Covid-19 cases continue to rise.

TITLE: 'Not exactly a JFK profile in courage': Jim Acosta jabs Gov. DeSantis' retort to Biden
SUMMARY: CNN's Jim Acosta calls out GOP members' reluctance to push their supporters to get vaccinated as vaccination rates stall and the Delta variant continues to cause coronavirus cases to surge.

TITLE: Opinion: The culture war that's killing us
SUMMARY: The pioneering 19th century German physician Rudolf Virchow saw medicine "as the science of human beings" with "the obligation to point out problems" and seek their "theoretical solution." But it is up to politicians, he added, to "find the means for their actual solution."

TITLE: See where teams ranked in the overall Olympic medal count
SUMMARY: • The best photos from the Tokyo Olympics

TITLE: Trump's acting attorney general revealed 'frightening' activity at Justice Department, Senate Judiciary chair says
SUMMARY: • Former DOJ officials provide new details on Trump efforts to undermine election results

TITLE: Beheading of a diplomat's daughter shows how badly Pakistan is failing its women
SUMMARY: Few cases of femicide make headlines in Pakistan, but the beheading of an ambassador's daughter promises to test a legal system activists say has repeatedly failed victims of violence and needs urgent reform.

TITLE: Executive assistant to Andrew Cuomo details allegations of sexual harassment by New York governor
SUMMARY: An assistant to New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo, who until now has only been referred to as "Executive Assistant 1," has publicly identified herself and detailed her claims of sexual harassment by the embattled Democratic governor.

TITLE: 'He's hating the US': Impeachment witness on Fox News host's statements
SUMMARY: Retired Army Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman, a key witness to President Donald Trump's impeachment inquiry, tells CNN's Jim Acosta about his bond with Capitol police officers who responded during the January 6 insurrection. He also adds that the attacks on their credibility by Fox News host Tucker Carlson and others demonizes the United States.

TITLE: A Black realtor was showing a home to a Black father and son. They were handcuffed by Michigan police
SUMMARY: A Black realtor was showing a house to a Black man and his 15-year-old son in a Michigan suburb last week when they looked outside and saw police officers surrounding the property with their guns drawn.

TITLE: Analysis: What some progressive activists fail to realize: Democrats like their party
SUMMARY: Mainstream Democrats have been winning a lot of big primaries in 2021. Their latest win came on Tuesday in the primary for Ohio's 11th Congressional District special election: local legislator and party chair Shontel Brown -- backed by South Carolina Rep. Jim Clyburn and 2016 presidential nominee Hillary Clinton -- defeated Nina Turner, former co-chair of Sen. Bernie Sanders' 2020 campaign.

TITLE: Young people in West Virginia look to push Sen. Joe Manchin in hopes of passing federal voting rights legislation
SUMMARY: Gabby Cipollone loves her home state of West Virginia. But the 23-year-old says that isn't the case for many young West Virginians.

TITLE: Here's why Trump's attempted coup still matters
SUMMARY: CNN's Brian Stelter and John Avlon say it's important for the media to continue covering former President Donald Trump's last days in office because the full picture of Trump's "pathetic" coup attempt to overthrow democracy is just now starting to emerge.

TITLE: Arizona lawmaker faces calls for resignation after arrest on child sexual abuse charges
SUMMARY: Arizona's Republican governor and state lawmakers from both parties on Friday called on state Sen. Otoniel "Tony" Navarrete to resign, as he faces multiple felony charges in connection with allegedly sexually abusing a child.

TITLE: The world is on the brink of 'catastrophe,' leader of next UN climate talks warns
SUMMARY: Failure to act now on climate change will result in "catastrophic" consequences for the world, the leader of the United Nation's next climate talks has warned.

TITLE: Why Trump conservatives are embracing Hungary's autocracy
SUMMARY: New America CEO Anne-Marie Slaughter and Eurasia Group President Ian Bremmer say that Fox News host Tucker Carlson's embrace of Hungary's authoritarian leader Viktor Orbán reflects former President Donald Trump's vision of the Republican party.

TITLE: Cori Bush urges tenants to apply for local assistance as CDC eviction moratorium faces legal challenges
SUMMARY: Missouri Rep. Cori Bush, who captured national attention for her high-profile protest of a lapse in the federal eviction moratorium amid the Covid-19 pandemic, urged tenants on Sunday to apply for local assistance in case courts strike down the latest ban on certain evictions issued by the Biden administration.

TITLE: State suspends school board for not complying with mask requirements
SUMMARY: New Mexico Secretary of Education Ryan Stewart says he took the step to suspend the Floyd Municipal school board because they voted to refuse to follow the state's Covid-19 guidelines for masks and social distancing.

TITLE: Big Tech has its eyes set on the metaverse. Here's what that means
SUMMARY: Facebook has many pressing problems, from proposed antitrust legislation to accusations that the company is contributing to vaccine misinformation. But when CEO Mark Zuckerberg joined a recent conference call with analysts to discuss its latest quarterly results, much of the focus was on something far removed from those issues: the metaverse. During the hour-long call, the metaverse was mentioned nearly two dozen times.

TITLE: After latest suicide, the Vessel in New York City's Hudson Yards ponders its future
SUMMARY: In a December 2016 article for The Architect's Newspaper, journalist Audrey Wachs noted a glaring issue with the Vessel, the 150-foot-tall tourist attraction that was set to open in New York City's gleaming new Hudson Yards neighborhood.

TITLE: Her husband needs this life-support machine, and says Florida has none to spare
SUMMARY: Florida resident Susan Walker says she is desperately searching out of state for an ECMO treatment machine for her husband since there are none available in her state as hospitals are overrun with Covid-19 patients.

TITLE: Malls are back. But for how long?
SUMMARY: Few retail sectors were hit harder than malls during the height of the pandemic. But things bounced back far quicker than almost anyone expected.

TITLE: 'Office' actor talks troubles of playing character
SUMMARY: Creed Bratton joins New Day to talk about 'The Office' and his reflections from his time on the show.

TITLE: Race against time: Inside ATF's efforts to find shooters before they strike again
SUMMARY: Gunfire in broad daylight along a busy street in the nation's capital last month sent bystanders running.

TITLE: Take a look at perfectly preserved Ice Age animal
SUMMARY: A well-preserved cave lion cub found in Siberia's permafrost is 28,000 years old, according to researchers. The Siberian Simba, nicknamed Sparta, was one of two baby cave lions found in 2017 and 2018 by mammoth tusk hunters.

TITLE: 'The Suicide Squad' underwhelmed at the box office. Here's why
SUMMARY: "The Suicide Squad," a new, R-rated superhero film from Warner Bros., opened to an estimated $26.5 million at the North American box office this weekend. That number came in under industry expectations, which projected the film to make around $30 million. The movie took in $72.2 million worldwide, according to the studio.

TITLE: Here's what's streaming this month across platforms
SUMMARY: A look at some of the series and films coming to streaming sites this month.

TITLE: Review: This new Netflix series may pop up in your queue this weekend, and it's certainly binge-able
SUMMARY: It's the end of another week, end of another Olympics and the end of my hopes of becoming the next "Jeopardy" host (Although, I never had any chance because I'm a woman and a person of color. Bazinga.)

TITLE: 'Lessons from the Water' doesn't just highlight Black trauma. It works to heal it
SUMMARY: One of the earliest lessons a child learns is the malleability of water.

TITLE: Analysis: Cancer robbed Val Kilmer of his voice, but he's finding a way to have his say
SUMMARY: Seeing celebrities through their own eyes and stories can be fraught with ... exaggeration. Or, if the star has been particularly introspective, a lot can be learned.

TITLE: Actress Markie Post dies at 70 after battle with cancer
SUMMARY: Markie Post, the actress known for her roles in "Night Court" and "The Fall Guy," has died. She was 70 years old.

TITLE: Bobby Bowden, who led Florida State University to two national championships, has died
SUMMARY: Bobby Bowden, the famed college football coach who led Florida State University for over 30 years and transformed the Tallahassee team into a powerhouse, died Sunday, the school said in a statement. He was 91.

TITLE: Comedian and actor Trevor Moore dies at 41
SUMMARY: Trevor Moore, comedian, actor, producer, and co-founder of the sketch comedy group The Whitest Kids U Know, has died at the age of 41.

TITLE: Dennis Thomas, Kool & the Gang co-founder, has died
SUMMARY: Kool & the Gang co-founder Dennis Thomas, often referred to as "Dee Tee," has died. He was 70 years old.

TITLE: Divers find a submerged car that's believed to belong to a woman missing since 1978
SUMMARY: New Hampshire Fish and Game search divers found human remains on Friday in a submerged car believed to belong to a woman who has been missing for 43 years.

TITLE: Guns N' Roses release their first new song in 13 years
SUMMARY: Guns N' Roses fans are finally getting treated to new music after 13 years.

TITLE: This woman has the largest mouth in the world, according to Guinness
SUMMARY: Good Samaritans save a stranded orca, a woman fights off a coyote with a stick and Prince Harry surprises Meghan for her birthday. These are the must-watch videos of the week.

TITLE: Meet Truffles, the special kitty who wears glasses to help kids feel better about wearing theirs
SUMMARY: Nearly four years ago, Danielle Crull rescued a stray kitten from a forest in Pennsylvania.

TITLE: Manchin goes after the Fed on inflation
SUMMARY: Democratic Senator Joe Manchin is taking the Federal Reserve to task over inflation

TITLE: Target will cover 100% of college tuition for its workers
SUMMARY: Target has announced that it will begin paying the college tuition and textbook expenses for its US-based part-time and full-time employees who attend select schools.

TITLE: Millions of jobs are unfilled, despite high levels of unemployment
SUMMARY: It's been roughly 18 months since the coronavirus pandemic started wreaking havoc on the US economy. The labor market is a long way from making a complete recovery.

TITLE: People are flocking to Applebee's. This popular song is one reason why
SUMMARY: The pandemic was difficult for casual dining brands like Applebee's, which saw sales plummet when it closed its dining rooms last year. But now, Applebee's is doing better than it has in years.

The US was this close to an attempted Trump coup
SUMMARY: We were a single Donald Trump whim away from an actual coup last January, one backed by the weight of the United States Department of Justice. We were thatclose.

TITLE: Why Tucker Carlson went to Hungary
SUMMARY: When Tucker Carlson, host of the highest-rated show on Fox News, opened his show on Monday, he appeared not behind his glossy desk, but in front of the ornate spires of Budapest, Hungary. Standing near the banks of the Danube, he explained why he was suddenly 4,000 miles from his studio. "If you care about Western civilization and democracy and families and the ferocious assault on all three of those things by the leaders of our global institutions, you should know what is happening here right now."

TITLE: How to loosen the hold rich people have on elections
SUMMARY: On August 2, The New Yorker's Jane Mayer, Pulitzer Prize nominee and investigative journalist par excellence, showcased her detective skills in a feature piece entitled "The Big Money Behind the Big Lie." Her research linked two dangerous threats to American democracy today -- election subversion and dark money.

SUMMARY: Florida is once again under siege from Covid-19, at the epicenter of a fourth wave.

TITLE: Rep. Cori Bush: I slept on the Capitol steps because I've been evicted three times in my life
SUMMARY: This week, the limitless power of people was on full display from the steps of the US House of Representatives.

TITLE: The ugly reality Belarusian sprinter faced
SUMMARY: After forcing down a civilian airliner from European skies in May to detain a journalist who was on board, perhaps it was only a matter of time before "Europe's last dictator," Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko, would be thrust back into the international spotlight and once again face fresh condemnation for his abhorrent actions.
